We follow the principle of equal treatment to consider all job applicants and do not discriminate based on their gender, sexual orientation, color, racial or ethnic origin, religion, disability, etc. as per applicable law.

Title: Manufacturing Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Manufacturing Engineer – Radiometer

In our line of work, life isn’t a given - it’s the ultimate goal. When life takes an unexpected turn, our technology and solutions enable caregivers to make informed diagnostic decisions to improve patient care. This is our shared purpose at Radiometer and what unites all +4000 of us - no matter our roles or where in the world we’re located. Creating impactful innovations like ours, doesn’t happen overnight - it requires uncompromising persistency, passion, and a desire to make a difference. Here, you can learn, grow, and chart an uncommonly diverse career.

Radiometer is proud to work alongside a community of six fellow Diagnostics Companies at Danaher. Together, we’re working at the pace of change to improve patient lives with diagnostic tools that address the world’s biggest health challenges. At Radiometer, our vision is to improve global healthcare with reliable, fast, and easy patient diagnoses.

The Manufacturing Engineer for Radiometer is responsible for process and quality monitoring of different automated or semi-automated production processes.

This position is a part of the Solution Plant located in Brønshøj and is an on-site position.

If you thrive in a fast-paced production environment with innovative colleges and want to work to help caregivers, make diagnostic decisions that save lives and improve global healthcare with reliable, fast, and easy patient diagnoses, then continue reading.

You will be a part of the Ampoule and Bottle Production team consisting of a manager, an engineer, 3 technicians and 22 operators. You will report to the Value Stream manager, responsible for the manufacturing of bottles and ampoules. Here you will support and ensure an efficient and reliable production in close cooperation with the plant’s other engineers, technicians and operators. The Solution Plant produces important accessories for our blood gas analysis devices, to maintain the high quality of measurements, calibration as well as rinsing.

In This Role, You Will Have The Opportunity To


Take ownership of product manufacturing processes and lead process optimization and project execution.
Drive systematic problem solving.
Lead Engineering Change Orders and Nonconformity processes.
Optimization of production equipment, along with commissioning and validation, in collaboration with our Engineering department.
Participation in LEAN activities and Kaizen events.
Interacting with relevant internal stakeholders influencing the department’s deliverables, such as Engineering, R&D and Quality departments


The Qualifications We Value Include


An academic degree (bachelor or master) within a technical field.
A general understanding of mechanical structures.
Strong data driven problem solving abilities.
Tech-savvy and an understanding of software and database systems.
Continuous optimization of workflows and processes, including updating of procedure and work instructions.
Independent, responsible, analytical, and solution oriented.
Fluent in Danish and English.


It would be a plus if you also possess previous experience in:


Having professional experience within Good Manufacturing Practice (GMP) and validation.
Knowledge of and working with LEAN.
Label application machines as well as barcode readers and software.
Audit inspection and preparation.


Application

We assess applications on an ongoing basis and invite suitable candidates for interviews. If this position matches your qualifications and ambitions, we encourage you to apply without delay.

We look forward to reviewing your application.

Danaher

Join our winning team today. Together, we’ll accelerate the real-life impact of tomorrow’s science and technology. We partner with customers across the globe to help them solve their most complex challenges, architecting solutions that bring the power of science to life.

For more information, visit www.danaher.com.
Show more

Radiometer is proud to work alongside a community of six fellow Diagnostics Companies at Danaher. Together, we’re working at the pace of change to improve patient lives with diagnostic tools that address the world’s biggest health challenges. At Radiometer, our vision is to improve global healthcare with reliable, fast, and easy patient diagnoses.

The Manufacturing Engineer for Radiometer is responsible for process and quality monitoring of different automated or semi-automated production processes.

This position is a part of the Solution Plant located in Brønshøj and is an on-site position.

If you thrive in a fast-paced production environment with innovative colleges and want to work to help caregivers, make diagnostic decisions that save lives and improve global healthcare with reliable, fast, and easy patient diagnoses, then continue reading.

You will be a part of the Ampoule and Bottle Production team consisting of a manager, an engineer, 3 technicians and 22 operators. You will report to the Value Stream manager, responsible for the manufacturing of bottles and ampoules. Here you will support and ensure an efficient and reliable production in close cooperation with the plant’s other engineers, technicians and operators. The Solution Plant produces important accessories for our blood gas analysis devices, to maintain the high quality of measurements, calibration as well as rinsing.

In This Role, You Will Have The Opportunity To

  • Take ownership of product manufacturing processes and lead process optimization and project execution.
  • Drive systematic problem solving.
  • Lead Engineering Change Orders and Nonconformity processes.
  • Optimization of production equipment, along with commissioning and validation, in collaboration with our Engineering department.
  • Participation in LEAN activities and Kaizen events.
  • Interacting with relevant internal stakeholders influencing the department’s deliverables, such as Engineering, R&D and Quality departments

The Qualifications We Value Include

  • An academic degree (bachelor or master) within a technical field.
  • A general understanding of mechanical structures.
  • Strong data driven problem solving abilities.
  • Tech-savvy and an understanding of software and database systems.
  • Continuous optimization of workflows and processes, including updating of procedure and work instructions.
  • Independent, responsible, analytical, and solution oriented.
  • Fluent in Danish and English.

It would be a plus if you also possess previous experience in:

  • Having professional experience within Good Manufacturing Practice (GMP) and validation.
  • Knowledge of and working with LEAN.
  • Label application machines as well as barcode readers and software.
  • Audit inspection and preparation.

Application

We assess applications on an ongoing basis and invite suitable candidates for interviews. If this position matches your qualifications and ambitions, we encourage you to apply without delay.

We look forward to reviewing your application.

Danaher

Join our winning team today. Together, we’ll accelerate the real-life impact of tomorrow’s science and technology. We partner with customers across the globe to help them solve their most complex challenges, architecting solutions that bring the power of science to life.

For more information, visit www.danaher.com.

Title: Freelance Electrical Engineering Expert with Python Experience - AI Trainer
Place: Denmark
Description:
This opportunity is only for candidates currently residing in the specified country. Your location may affect eligibility and rates. Please submit your resume in English and indicate your level of English.

At Mindrift, innovation meets opportunity. We believe in using the power of collective intelligence to ethically shape the future of AI.

What We Do

The Mindrift platform connects specialists with AI projects from major tech innovators. Our mission is to unlock the potential of Generative AI by tapping into real-world expertise from across the globe.

About The Role

GenAI models are improving very quickly, and one of our goals is to make them capable of addressing specialized questions and achieving complex reasoning skills. If you join the platform as an AI Tutor in Electrical Engineering, you'll have the opportunity to collaborate on these projects.

Although every project is unique, you might typically:


Generate prompts that challenge AI.
Define comprehensive scoring criteria to evaluate the accuracy of the AI's answers.
Correct the model's responses based on your domain-specific knowledge


How To Get Started

Simply apply to this post, qualify, and get the chance to contribute to projects aligned with your skills, on your own schedule. From creating training prompts to refining model responses, you'll help shape the future of AI while ensuring technology benefits everyone.

Requirements


You hold a Bachelor's, Master's or PhD Degree in Engineering and/or in relevant area.
You have at least 3 years of professional experience with focus in one of the following fields: Power Engineering, Control Systems Engineering, Electronics Engineering, Communication Systems Engineering, Signal Processing, Instrumentation Engineering, Microelectronics, VLSI Engineering, Embedded Systems, Renewable Energy Systems, Robotics and Automation, Power Electronics, Electric Machines and Drives, Electromagnetics, High Voltage Engineering, Power System Protection, Lighting Systems Engineering, Electrical Safety Engineering, Smart Grid Technologies, Distributed Energy Systems & Microgrids, Electric Vehicle (EV) Systems
Your level of English is advanced (C1) or above.
Proficiency in Python, with experience using libraries such as NumPy, SciPy, and Pandas.
Strong ability to design creative and diverse problems, particularly those that are computationally intensive and go beyond simple parameter modifications.
You are ready to learn new methods, able to switch between tasks and topics quickly and sometimes work with challenging, complex guidelines.
Our freelance role is fully remote so, you just need a laptop, internet connection, time available and enthusiasm to take on a challenge


Benefits

Why this freelance opportunity might be a great fit for you?


Get paid for your expertise, with rates that can go up to $50/hour depending on your skills, experience, and project needs
Take part in a part-time, remote, freelance project that fits around your primary professional or academic commitments
Work on advanced AI projects and gain valuable experience that enhances your portfolio
Influence how future AI models understand and communicate in your field of expertise
Show more

Title: Swatch Copenhagen Seeking Part-Time Sales Associate (25 hrs/week)
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
The Company

SWATCH – More Than Just a Watch - Everyone recognizes a Swatch watch when they see one. It stands for a Swiss explosion of color, fun, and creativity. Accessories with attitude, for all ages and all occasions.

Job Description

Are you interested in fashion and design, and do you enjoy sales where you think a little outside the box? As a Sales Assistant in our Swatch store in Copenhagen, you’ll have the opportunity to help develop an exciting and fun brand that stands out from the crowd. It’s a colourful and multicultural adventure for anyone with an interest in and knowledge of accessories.

As a Sales Assistant in the Swatch store, teamwork is essential. Together with the Store Manager, you and the other sales assistants set the tone. For this role it’s an advantage if you are enthusiastic about fashion and innovation. It’s also important that you can maintain an overview, even during busy periods.

Profile

We Expect That You Are/Have:


A high level of professionalism
An outgoing teamplayer
A positive and cheerful attitude that fits the Swatch image
Interest in and experience working with fashion and accessories
Comfortable in a fast-paced work environment



Languages

The position requires that you speak fluent English, additional languages are a plus.

Job Location: 1100 Copenhagen, Denmark

Company Address: The Swatch Group (Nordic) AB P.O. Box 12033 112 34 Stockholm Sweden

Title: Sales Representative Simulation
Place: Høje Taastrup, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Are you our new colleague?

We are looking for a dedicated Business Development Manager (BDM) to join our growing simulation team!




About the role

As our new BDM you will be working with both existing customers and new potential customers. You will ensure our customers gets just the right simulation software and experience to fit their need and organization, enabling them to be more successful and innovative.




At PLM Group, your overall goal will be to guide and sell simulation software solutions to our customers, enabling them to develop new and better products faster. You will be a part of our Nordic Simulation team, where we enable and ensure customers to be successful in developing their products and services with the help of high end simulation software from our partner Dassault Systémes.




As a BDM you will have a varied everyday work life and tasks, including but not limited to;

· Land new sales opportunities

· Expand value adding services and simulation solutions to existing customers

· Maintain and develop high level of customer satisfaction

· Contribute to cross border cooperation and development of sales processes and best practice to team and PLM Group




We offer an exciting job in an international company with great development opportunities. We provide you with all the support and trainings you need to become a successful sales person.




You will be part of a Nordic simulation team of 25 colleagues working in sales and technical consulting and support, many which you will be working close with. You will be reporting to a group sales manager. You will mainly work with Danish customers, with some work travels throughout the year.




We are over 40 colleagues in PLM Group Denmark working in different departments and business areas, all of us with the mindset of providing our customers with the best solutions possible. We are a modern workplace and focus on work life- balance and offer the flexibility of remote work for all our employees when needed.




This position will be located in one of our danish office in Høje Taastrup

About you




We expect you to be passionate about value-added selling and keen on learning and exploring new technology and software.




You preferably have experience in selling software and/or value-added service. Experience in selling SaaS (Software as a service) is an advantage. You have a proved track record of successful sales project management




You need to speak Danish fluently and have good English skills, as the corporate language is English in PLM Group.




You have experience in outbound sales roles




You have experience in selling advanced simulation software




You are customer- oriented and have a good business understanding. As you will be leading your own sales projects and be the main customer contact, it´s important that you are structured and used to problem solving with the customer needs in focus.




You are a team player, sharing your ideas and help to develop the team and by doing so, contributing making PLM Group a great place to work.




About PLM Group

PLM Group is the largest SOLIDWORKS and 3DEXPERIENCE reseller in the Nordics and Baltics. We are a company in constant development, to continue offering the best technology and expertise in Software. Our main goal is to make our customers innovate, to help them get the best success opportunities with their SOLIDWORKS, 3DEXPERIENCE and other Dassault Systems products.




We are more than 160 employees in Northern Europe and the Baltics. Our organization structure provides efficient communication and knowledge sharing between colleagues all over PLM Group and enables the individual employee to both create and improve their own work environment and career in PLM Group.




Want to know more?

We would love to talk more with you! Do not hesitate to send your application here on LinkedIN




Questions about the position and PLM Group can be directed to;




HR Manager: Timothy Nilsholm

Email: timothy.nilsholm@plmgroup.se

Phone: +46 70 438 50 02




Sales Manager: Tadas Vidziunas

Email: tadas.vidziunas@plmgroup.eu

Phone: +370 66948280




We are looking forward to hear from you!
